pOVRJlegijAjj5cf97_49w.text: This place is great. Outdoor area is nice. Fresh squeezed orange juice, jenga, and tacos. What more do you need?

M2nfip1QTFq33KJRbbe7Gg.text: This is a beautiful/fun venue with lots of options.. on a slushy winter Saturday the downstairs places (Olive Tap, Courtyard Wines and East End Brewery) were hopping.. the restaurant wasn't busy and it was easy to get a table and order-- I ordered what was basically a perogie pizza and it was really good, but at $5/slice a bit pricey. The banana/ squash pancakes were not my fav but others I was with liked them and again $5 for 2 small pancakes is pricey .. It was disappointing that brunch was the only option until 2PM on a Saturday and that only one of the three food stations were open as I was hoping to try more things.  The wine library looked really nice -- There's some serious potential for this place to be great and I'm excited to see where it goes...

_qFaYySdAlXgjgBaf0Nx4w.text: Everything about this place is unwelcoming, confusing and disappointing. There is no one around to answer questions and the staff that we did see exuded attitude.  There were handfuls of would-be customers wandering around trying to figure out what to do, we saw several give up and leave. Once we figured out that there were more food vendors located upstairs we ordered a few things. No one from Nibbles was at their counter so we couldn't ask any questions, but the Bistro folks were taking orders for Nibbles so obviously someone from Nibbles was physically there, somewhere. We ordered a flatbread with cashew cheese and received a plate of warm pita bread with a tiny amount of very bland cashew cheese. It gave us a good laugh but it was terrible. The Croque Madame from Bistro was fantastic--that's where the two stars come from. The sandwich from the Charcuterie place was just ok, mostly bread. Bathrooms were dirty and the paper towel holders were broken in the men's and women's rooms.

9g2Zb7UPjlWPxF8bUduDjg.text: This place is great!! If you are looking for a cool place to hang, they have a shared food kitchen, a full bar and a wine library!! If you are looking for good conversation while Steeler game commercials are on, head to the wine library and ask for PJ (he won't steer you wrong!) He will do whatever it takes to find you the perfect drink. If you are looking for a chill place to hang and feel welcomed and included, this is the place for you :)

mwat6FRJWmexWKTrsFNqnw.text: Atmosphere was great.  Open seating and a decent sized bar on the second level (small draft selection though).  Wine bar had a relaxed vibe with couches and low tables.   Now for the food which is why I give 3 stars.  Calamari texture was similar to rubber bands.  shrimp appetizer tasted good but 4 shrimp for 13.00? it's a casual market not a high end seafood restaurant!  the bruschetta appetizer was nothing special. For these reasons our group of 5 decided not to stay for dinner.   The outdoor beer garden looked very nice! I would go back in warmer weather just to have drinks and MAYBE give the food another shot.

LTl1iuc9F2p0LZeUkDpm1g.text: The place clearly has potential--but they're going to lose a lot of customers if they're not more attentive to ramping up their service.  The wait time at the bar (regardless of whether first or second floor) is unbelievably slow.  If you open a tab, you're still stuck waiting in line to get an additional drink and then to close out your tab.  If you don't have a schedule and are up for hanging out and waiting (and waiting!) then it's a fun venue.  The outdoor lighting leaves a lot to be desired--it's hard to see after dark because the lights are strung up over the roofing.  The evening we were there none of the gas heaters were on...and a few should have been, it was a bit chilly in the courtyard.  Stand near Dante's pizza stand and you'll feel warm enough to cope.  Unfortunately, pizza was the only food available this pas weekend.  Once Edgar's taco stand opens, I'll reconsider whether I want to brave the crowds and the slow wait for a pricey beverage.  While nicely renovated, my overall take away was kind of meh.

7rV9QJl3XcWfIr6cS2ZXYQ.text: So I ordered from Bistro 108. Grilled shrimp with peas pesto and peas, and Hummus. The shrimp was not grilled and literally swimming in a pool of olive oil and there were no peas to be found. The hummus seemed to have been blended with what I think may have been white caneli beans and so pasty it was inedible. The bit of veggies it came with was celery which were brown on both ends. The atmosphere is terrific and that is why I gave two stars.

SNTvE--0RQ2GIrAvRM43MQ.text: This vibe is HIP to the max.  I only grabbed a glass of wine from the "Wine Library," but it was easily one of the best wines I've had in a while.  We simply sat in these luxurious leather seats to enjoy it.  Come here if you want to feel like 3 million bucks. Probably because it's so hip and so new, 'them prices be high'. Just a factor.

6D8CL7AVIzmtMFOXhI5wEQ.text: Multiple food and drink options in a newish hipster version of the shopping-mall food court. Edgar's Tacos and the upstairs pizza station both prepared food well. Main drawbacks were speakers in every corner piping garage-band music with no quiet areas inside nor outside. The outdoor eating area were decent although they need more umbrellas.

yvX_Ap-HDGrU2Em6iURuwQ.text: Attended the cocktail event and I absolutely loved it very informative and got to make some new recipes for cocktails. The ambiance and vibe is amazing along with the food. It's a must to visit!

MojNrVKT3IM--nHK67CWbw.text: The Pennsylvania Market is a great concept; and with some attention could become a great addition to the Pittsburgh Strip District!  The atmosphere is awesome; though the second floor was "empty" on a Saturday night.  The few patrons that were there, were at the bar, and we still had to wait to be acknowledged and served!  (Bartender was actually rude, and the drinks were mediocre) There was not a taco spot as advertised, a coffee  shop was closed; leaving three food options.  It is cafeteria style, so you need to order your food at the counter and then find a seat.  We tried a $25 "large" cheese board; cannot tell you how disappointing!!  The board itself IS large; though sparsely filled with a scattering of nibble size pieces of cheese, a handful of nuts, raisins, orange peels and a "fancy" glaze for presentation...  NOT worth the price!! We decided to leave and enjoy a dinner at another establishment! Sorry; but probably won't consider returning any time soon!!

PZXVH8h2AKD0nVVanMoxZw.text: Service is slow at the bar and at Nibbles, where the cashier was more interested in her phone than my order. Charcuterie plate was great. Nibbles jambalaya was ok, but it had shrimp in it with the entire shell on. It was a Friday around happy hour and most of the first floor shops were closed.

u-vKptrAUOMnA3XQ7OmalQ.text: I don't think I will return anytime soon. The venue is really amazing and I definitely feel they have the potential to rival similar offerings such as Smallman Galley. We came especially for the pizza which, though delicious, was dramatically overpriced. We spent $30 (incl. tip/tax) to get 4 small slices that were the size of a Totino's party pizza if you stuck them together. The two of us were so hungry we made a meal when we returned home. Our bartender was also very cold and unwelcoming.   Lower your prices, hire more attentive bar staff, and this place could really be great. Also, consider posting the hours that you serve food somewhere online.

5h_6wxm9ldW8nQfQD3Noaw.text: I can't say enough great things about this spot. Service, wine and atmosphere are all outstanding. Keep up the great work.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine library
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine bar

7QcCYFXIzdb9pOwzi6xrKw.text: I really wanted to like it. It's a beautiful space but I hope processes will get better with time. I had ordered a cheese platter and after not receiving it for 45 mins I went to check on it and was told they forgot about it and would start making it now. I don't know how that even happens but did not find it acceptable when we were paying nearly $30 for it. Ordered another dish from a different restaurant which I waited over an hour for and still hadn't received it--was told they were still working on it..so I canceled my order. Also my friend waited 15-20 mins at the bar just to close her tab. Overall poor experience, can't imagine going back soon,unfortunately...Which is a bummer because it's pretty cool looking place

jBaYHZOBN17cyutIDL3HPA.text: A lot of issues still need to be ironed out before I'd consider returning.  Go to Smallman Galley for a similar experience done right.  The space is large and inviting and seemed like a great spot for a family with a mix of young kids, vegetarians, and foodies. Unfortunately, it was barely functional on Friday afternoon.  I ordered a sandwich only to have it refunded 5 minutes later because they were "out of bread."  I ordered beers, but the bartender didn't have any pint glasses, so we got small pours (with an apology and an appropriate discount, but still).  One food counter ran out of burgers. Half of us ended up with pizza, which was tasty. The other half decided to get food elsewhere.  Just disappointing.

OR5j5YV3MWdHTK-4z_nu6w.text: Fun spot! Great outdoor area. Perfect for a summer hangout with your friends. The place is beautiful inside, as well. Connected to a East End Brewery, but unfortunately you cannot buy beer there and bring it over to the market. This is due to Pennsylvania liquor laws. It has a similar concept to Federal and Smallman gallery, including a pizza spot. Unfortunately, Federal Galley wins the award for best pizza, but this would not stop me from going there and grabbing a slice! I would 100% recommend.

mkGCrye_1wO2KSVParj8cQ.text: The space alone is 5 star worthy, it is exceptional. When you walk in and see a large marble bar and leather couches to lounge on you get the impression you are in the right place....  The staff there was questionable.... not very friendly, not very informative, and very very slow to fulfill orders.... and there was maybe 10 people total  in the room. I Ordered a $30 charcuterie board, you would think for $30 you would have a giant wood plank with large varieties of meats and cheeses.... instead you get a handful of meat, some unwashed grapes, and generic cheeses such as cheddar and Parmesan... we also received no information on what was on the board and waited about 30-40 minutes for it.  My in-laws ordered Chicken and some soup from the bistro (Which took about 45 minutes). Both were very very good, but not worth the price at all! $16 for a large piece of a chicken breast...... nothing else..... who in their right mind would come back and order a $16 piece of chicken that comes with no sides......  I browsed the Pizza menu..... and Noped out of there when I saw they were selling small slices of pizza for $6 each.....  This place is still trying to find their Niche and get their foot in the door... They need to find their identity, but they are going to scare many many people away with a unfriendly uninformative slow staff that is selling extremely over priced food.  They need to focus on the space.... which a perfect place to grab a glass of wine, hang with some friends, read a book, get some coffee or do some work. focus on small bites/appetizers and SELL THEM AT A REASONABLE PRICE!!! maybe get a actual wait staff to bring food and drinks to your table.... play some live music and have some events up there to bring people in...  This place needs a lot of improvements to bring me back and recommend it to people

tHC3HPpdakmIBFJOE7Byjg.text: The bartender was nice, but bored, as there were only 6 people in the entire upstairs area. That seemed odd for dinner time in the strip, but after paying $17 (plus tip) for a small square of dried up hard crusted pizza and a beer, I understand why. A "jazz" band started playing to the empty room, and I could understand why there was nobody there to see that either (and it wasn't even jazz). Whoever manages this place needs to rethink the entire concept. It's a cool old building, but it comes across as a cheesy (and expensive) food court at an abandoned mall. If you're looking for good food with an authentic vibe, there are much better options nearby.

3RkxsHEOt2aTnvZvCG0meg.text: This is a lovely space and a great addition to the strip! We popped into a few shops and had some drinks before the Steelers game.  It has a great outdoor area and a lovely wine library.  I cannot attest to the food because we only had drinks but we had a great experience.  The wine library would be a great pre or post dinner hangout.  We look forward to a return trip!

Nvg4TfMqS3W5buhT-YQGCQ.text: Great atmosphere. Top shelf staff. Excellent food. Wonderful wine bar with knowledgeable staff.

xI61O0lhOUWUYXTiTspI1Q.text: I really wanted to love this place however, both of the two trips I have made thus far were disappointing. The pizza was delicious and the crust was perfection, but if you are charging $5-6 a slice you should get a little more for your money.. bar service on a Wednesday and a Saturday were similar as far as waiting 5-10 min for a drink. Food is good but expensive, service is average. Good for one visit to check it out, but I would spend my time elsewhere in the strip..

kf_GJZ22-MHXgvmpOOx7aA.text: Romulus pizza was bomb . There was a bit of a wait  but I guess that's expected given they just opened. Going to check out the other food options on my next visit

22mXAjSW0gaXs7Qda6x6KA.text: Cool concept. Similar to Smallman Galley set up. Plenty of seating. The bar and wine library really set it apart from Smallman Galley. Great wine selection with a knowledge bartender. We went on a weeknight and it was great service. We all split meatballs, pizza, and a sandwich. The meatballs were AMAZING. Delicious food and great music selection. Will definitely be back!

zKJ39P_dy_TUQjQ0fz1ZUg.text: My family and I came here on a Friday night before a holiday show.  It was perfect! Everyone loved the food.  I had the salmon, and it was delicious.  The service was fantastic as well.  All our food came out within 10 minutes of ordering.  I highly recommend!

eVnUYcFAmATBqAoBD-fU6Q.text: I spotted this establishment from afar when walking to the strip for a brunch spot that would satisfy my quickly-changing palate. THIS WAS THE PERFECT PLACE. This galley-esque style of dining offered many different types of foods from enchiladas to breakfast tacos to mussles. I was overwhelmed at first because I had no idea what this place was and was very pleasantly surprised when I got to the second floor of the building where there were 4 different restaurants as well as a wine library. Tony, the owner of the establishment, was incredibly personable and immediately came up to my friend and I to talk us through the different areas of the building. He introduced us to other staff and even offered to cook us one of the daily specials (which is a family recipe of his). Downstairs also houses a brewery and the courtyard outside looks as though it would be worthy of a great atmosphere for a night out with friends. The food overall was both delicious and affordable for such a beautifully layed out space. I highly recommend the Pennsylvania Market as not just a Sunday brunch meal but for anyone who is looking for a laid-back open atmosphere that has many different foods and drinks to offer for you and all of your friends. Definitely a place to share food with pals. I will definitely be back for multiple different reasons (maybe to have brunch, maybe to have a Friday night in the courtyard, maybe to study or do work online on a weekday?).

6eUoTDEc8ldtPFta9KJztQ.text: This restaurants food was delicious HOWEVER myself & my friend found a razor blade in our fries. I saw mine before eating it but my friend had the razor blade in his mouth. This could have been a very bad situation & the restaurant was acting as if it wasn't a big deal. They did refund us for our meals and give us some free drinks but this could have been a very bad situation.

9nyzjr30i537theObXqrSw.text: I've had pizza from Romulus 3 times now (twice at a local brewery pop up and once at the Pa market).  I've been a fan of Roman style pizza for a few years and they have effectively nailed it.    The crust was crispy on the outside and had a nice chew once you reached the middle.  The toppings (I had an amazing breakfast pizza with a cracked egg) were smoked and charred to perfection!    At the market, we had a few traditional slices that were crisp and radiating with flavor as well.  The sauce is bright with a slightly acidic base.    Even my daughter liked it and let's face it, most kids are stuck on the run of the mill Squirrel Hill pizza joints.  I could see how someone wouldn't be a fan of this pizza if they were used to cookie cutter pizza factories, but in terms of art- these guys are the Picasso's of Roman pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OWGVuPGPcb8Fmzb3vekEmA.text: Prioritize your time in the Strip District on something else, but I'll be keeping my eye (and mixed feelings) on this.  The Pennsylvania Market is a nicely renovated space, but not particularly authentic. The shops are fine, but the mix is closer to the stands at Ross Park Mall than the summer farmers' market in Market Square.   If you are looking for market items, step out to the street on a weekend. If you are looking for a food hall, Smallman Galley is around the corner. If you are looking to kill some time, I guess the wine library upstairs could be acceptable. The pizza at Romulus is admittedly delicious. We got the funghi and ricotta - perfectly soft and crispy, balanced with saltiness from the cheese and earthiness of the mushrooms, with a nice hint of garlic.  The woman leading tastings at Courtyard Winery did a good job (we bought a nice red blend). The space upstairs was nice, and the employees, although inattentive, were nice. I'm not sure that nice makes parking in the strip worth it, though.  Looking forward for the outside courtyard to open when the temperatures warm up to give this another shot.   2.5-stars: Go if you're in the neighborhood and a little desperate ------ Ratings: 5: Go today 4: Go tomorrow 3: Go if you're in the neighborhood 2: Go if you're desperate 1: Go somewhere else

unTmnUdhugdSBBmaz2YfIw.text: I wanted to love this place, I tried multiple times. First experience not bad good cocktails nice crowd but the food options were just not great. I got the hummus which I enjoyed but my friends sandwich from nibbles was boring & could have easily been a simple sandwich made at home. Second time we stopped by during the day and no bartender was outside in the court yard so we walked away. My third time last night was the worst by far. Happy hour around 5pm & it was so hot! I mean HOT upstairs where the only open bar was available so we suffered through it. Every person in our group complained about the heat but nothing happened. We did an indoor happy hour bc we thought it would be cooler but no this was just a terrible terrible terrible experience. Giving 3 stars bc the bartender was friendly/nice & the beers were cheap for happy hour. I'll only go back in the winter or if they get some air conditioning upstairs. Such a cool concept, but a big let down.

QiyLBRmQ2DpglK4iHzZREg.text: I want to love this place. I do. But after my second time here I have to call it quits. The service at the bar is not what it should be with 2 bartenders and about 12 people sitting at the bar. Both times I had to ask a bartender to wait on me. And the cocktails were NOT GOOD. The space is so lovely. I just wish the staff were as invested as the two guys who were trying to hang that huge PA market sign during happy hour.

dOEVc7CfKEcvco2ld6QWaA.text: Cool space. Mediocre food. Not a Pittsburgh native, so I must ask... is there something about Mondays and Tuesdays where people just don't go out? The place (and the rest of the strip district, really) felt empty. After aimless walking the seemingly abandoned streets, my friends and I decided to try PA Market after being enticed by the outdoor balcony. The space has many seating options, and really seems like a great spot to bring some friends and catch up over a drink.  As a whole, I would say that the place would be a potentially good spot for drinks, but would probably skip for food. I was pleasantly surprised that we walked in during happy hour, where drinks (at least the beer) was 50% off menu price. I got a raspberry wheat draft, which was very refreshing and not too sweet or sour. Perfect for a warm summer day.   The food, on the other hand, left a lot to be desired. I went to the charcuterie place and got a brie and pear panini. Unfortunately, they didn't have baguettes that day (which is what the the menu described as part of the sandwich). However, instead of informing me, they just replaced it with focaccia bread. The sandwich itself was OK. Bread replacement aside (which I wasn't too bothered by), I wasn't really impressed with the sandwich. For a panini, I was expecting a hot, gooey sandwich. This sandwich really missed that expectation. I wouldn't get it again.   Overall, I would give the food 2-stars, but think that the place has good potential as a place for drinks (thus adding one more star). The day just felt weird. There wasn't anyone at the cashier to get my order. Someone from a neighboring station had to come over. There was a decent number of drafts to pick from the menu, but the first 2 things we tried to order weren't even available. Perhaps the place was still working out some kinks, so I'm sure that some of what I experienced was a result of that. Probably wouldn't come again on my next trip to Pittsburgh. However, I don't want this review to discourage people from trying it during happy hour, cause the price seems pretty reasonable!

46ZMFoD7kVUraw_-8KkB-Q.text: CHRISTIAN "CHRIS" was our busser. We were visiting from D.C and left our phone.   He ran the entire strip to find and return it to us.  We are so grateful for his hospitality and great service!! An incredible asset to the PA Market experience and service.  Great location, food, selections + atmosphere.

iHHH4EB9lt9JVQ6EADKymw.text: I love that Pittsburgh has another food hall! I love Federal and Smallman Galley, and I have been anticipating the PA Market for a while and it has not disappointed me yet! The outdoor courtyard is gorgeous and I can't wait to check it out in the Spring. But for now, I am really enjoying the upstairs. Plenty of seating, 4 food spots to choose from, delicious cocktails and wine from all over the world- can't go wrong. I haven't tried too many food options yet, but I have tried meatballs from one of the restaurants and they were really great. I can't wait to come back when the weather gets nicer to take advantage of the outdoor courtyard and the outdoor seating on the 2nd floor.

8O0elvWdQMfqXE2oHD7eoQ.text: Super slow service and they ran of the breakfast special!   My family and I went the PA Market last Saturday morning for breakfast.  We were recruited to try it out while we were standing in line at Pamela's and that was a mistake.  We all ordered the special of the day which was French toast with strawberries and bananas.   Twenty-five minutes after we placed our order they came to our table and told us they only had enough bread for 3 of the 4 orders.  I changed my order to an omelet and finally 45 minutes after we placed our original order some of the meals started coming out and it wasn't until about 55 minutes did we have all the orders.   Good thing we didn't want to eat together.  It wasn't like they were busy either, there were only 4 other groups having breakfast!  Should have stayed and waited at Pamela's!    The manager did come out apologize, which was nice.

Cpq685nBpeqnhbmEnwYzIw.text: I love the PA market, the ambiance and decor set you up to have an amazing meal, whether it be brunch, dinner or just a snack and drinks with friends. The food is incredible- I've tried a few things so far but have not been disappointed at all. Love that it's in the heart of the Strip District because it's a great place to bring people for a fun day with a lot to do!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan Quiche, Shakshuka, Omelette, and vegan butternut squash pancakes

CsdW9rFzG4oBN2-13b1wDg.text: Matt was amazing. He was so helpful and informative. Great conversation. I will definitely be back and I recommend stopping by to see Matt! He will for sure make you the perfect cocktail!

RQcwb8_EHYAzxkaIeSDo7w.text: Very cool concept, and even nicer real estate but unfortunately the experience sucks. We waited 20+ minutes at the bar to try and get a drink, and got passed over several times. We then got some slices from Romulus Pizza, which tasted like the crust was baked last week and they tossed some sauce and toppings on this morning. Nevertheless, this place has a lot of potential, but they may need to walk down the block to Smallman Galley for a few pointers.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XEyWutDmg9qVSLCH4W7jbA.text: This place is awesome! The service was great! We were there Friday March 29, 2019. We sat at the wine bar. The bartender was very knowledgeable and so pleasant! She told us about upcoming wine classes. All I can say is this pace is so chill! The music playing in the background, wine a d food made for a very pleasant evening!  This is great place to sit and enjoy a drink or to take a first date. Any event would be made better by coming here! Love it!

logoQ2Z3E0EZe1lJtxlT3Q.text: **UPDATE My husband and I went back for cocktails on a Saturday night and were met with a most pleasant experience. The mixologist was very friendly and provided an enjoyable night. The cocktails were delicious and the company was perfect! Thank you for a great night Matt!!   The first time I went to The Pennsylvania Market on May 3rd, I was showing family around the city and decided to give this place a try even though it was dead on a Friday night. We were all blown away by the wonderful mixologist who was very pleasant and put on a great show for us. The four of us were the only ones sitting up at the cocktail bar and the drinks were delicious. We had a few drinks and made our way to the adjacent wine lounge where we relaxed and had a nice time.  On May 18th My husband and I went on a date night and decided to begin our night by going back for some pricey cocktails and relaxing ambiance. The place was busy in the courtyard but steady upstairs. We sat at the bar once again but this time we were not greeted and passed by several times.  The two female bartenders were chatting with one an other and the male bartender was making drinks and made eye contact several times. I finally leaned over the bar and flagged someone down. I was informed that they could not make 90% of the drinks because they were out of all the ingredients. When we finally were able to place our basic orders the female bartender stated she would not be making the mule because she WAS NOT cutting up limes. I am so mad we even ordered drinks. Please do yourself a favor and avoid this place. The attitude, lack of respect, and lack of couth from the bartenders was utterly shameful. How could this place decline so fast? To the females working there, you can wear all the skimpy clothes you want but your internal ugliness has shown your True colors. I have worked in food service and understand busy but common courtesy should be a given. Please remember customers provide revenue and without that you would not have a job. Treat everyone as you would like to be treated.

ZvnJRVlS-vTJLwUaErXDSw.text: I signed up for a cocktail mixing class and can I say AMAZING. I had so much fun learning about the drinks + making them. The atmosphere + staff were great. I definitely will take advantage of the many classes they have each month.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktail Mixing Class
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktail Mixing Class
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktail Mixing Class

QJ6xcOjpoKZ4jfGcMYAiJA.text: 7$ for a small slice of pizza? Kind of ridiculous. It was misleading as the slices were double the size then after you ordered they cut it half and handed it over.   It was still amazing tasting but I can't justify paying that again.  I know it's tough to judge the place on the first day so I'll update the review when I come back in a few weeks.

RQpB8GAQKnprANNPSZS5Ag.text: Ate at Bistro 108, took over 1 hour for a measly tiny piece of salmon 2x2 inches to come out. The place was empty. The staff was super rude, when it finally came out the mac was runny and had a strange aftertaste and the salmon was extreme over cooked. I had to go up and ask how much longer the wait was, a few times every time the woman rolled her eyes at me. For 40$ I would bring my money elsewhere. This was extremely disappointing experience.

3eTSfd__dS58SLXBiLUDFA.text: I hate to be too critical because it was only the second day they were opened, but the service was seriously lacking. The flow & lines didn't seem to be very well thought out. The fresh squeezed OJ was delicious & the truffle fries were pretty good, but the pizza could use some love. It's worth a stop for the atmosphere and experience, but plan on eating somewhere outside the market (ground floor, outside) to avoid the high prices and long wait

BsdvUSs10LjRIHS8jEjc6g.text: The food was ok & however they are limited because many items were sold out & also be careful with what you drink & check your ice I had pieces of glass mixed with my ice cubes in my glass in my drink and swallowed a few pieces. I filled out a report with the manager Andrew that day & gave him the glass pieces . Later in the week & After some issues I Tried to contact the restaurant numerous times with phone messages and emails & they never called back or responded to emails. I guess basically they do not care about their customers !

aKtiPA2Ev3cPiVPrWPcEVw.text: So I was to have a small party and chose this venue based on how nice the layout is, well that is all.  After a month of planning, with the only competent person that works there, Angela, we walk into a horrible way to start our day.  1. We pay $300 for a space at 3pm that is not set up until just at 3pm, our event started at 3pm.  2.  Andy, who was in charge when we arrived, had the absolute worst attitude.  It took both my mother and I having to be calm ourselves in order to deal with his attitude, whoever would treat someone like this that is paying lots of money and bringing lots 15+ people to your venue, who normally wouldn't go on their own.  3.  The bartenders are rude and SLOW.  I read on here that there was bad service and boy were they right.  They were snotty and very slow with a backed bar. 4.  The food was horrible, my poor guests.  The macaroni was dry and tasteless, the meatballs were gross.  The charcuterie board I could have done better at home  My guests told us that the food was bad.  So embarrassing.  Never will go back, absolutely horrible experience when it came to food and service.

BvawL3sjxGRR0GmCRVh2aA.text: It's definitely time I update my review.  My first time at the PA Market was less than great. The service was awful and the pizza left a lot to be desired.   Since then, I've returned on a few occasions. Once with a large group of friends, another time for a post work happy hour, and then another time for after dinner drinks. These visits were much better than my first. All of the friends that I've introduced to the PA Market absolutely love it. The outdoor courtyard addition is another reason why I'm upping my review. I am always on the lookout for new outdoor spaces in Pittsburgh, and the courtyard was right up my alley.   The bar service got a lot better since they opened. Service is much quicker and the bartenders are more helpful in deciding between the wine offerings. The craft cocktails are also phenomenal, but my favorite is a classic Aperol Spritz!   On my next visit, I will be sure to try out the charcuterie, since that's the way to my heart.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

T5LNUZewYsMR2O0fjIil_A.text: I'm only giving this place two stars because the environment is very nice and there is so much potential within the space. The ambiance upstairs is very warm and rustic.   I still stand by Edgar's being the best establishment that serves food here. Definitely not the best tacos in Pittsburgh in my opinion, however they are good.  I felt compelled to update my review here because I had an awful experience that I would like the community to know about.   My coworkers and I decided to go here for lunch. They decided on tacos and I wanted something healthy, so I ventured upstairs to Bistro 108 for a salad. Not many people were there, maybe three others. I thought it was a little overkill that the young woman behind the counter gave me a buzzer for when my food would be ready. I ordered a citrus and avocado salad and it took about 25 minutes for me to get my food. My coworkers met me upstairs and agreed that it was taking a very long time. When my food finally came out, the buzzer did not even go off! The food was presented in a sad soup container packaged in a plastic bag which the young woman gave me. Ok customer service wasn't the best, I'm not sure why I waited so long for a mediocre salad. The kicker is, I didn't even get avocado in the salad even though it was called a citrus avocado salad. The chicken that I added was not worth it one bit, it almost doubled the price of my salad and it was for five pieces of slightly burnt chicken.  Value was not there at all.   Don't be fooled by the beautiful ambiance at Pennsylvania Market, especially the upstairs. I am confident in saying the food sucks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

atjL9JG7_uJpsw52yVY1nQ.text: The best part about this place is the space. It's the only reason i'd give it 3 stars. With an outdoor patio and a large upstairs with high tops, low tops, and a comfortable lounge there are a lot of options to sit and relax. They also have a big central bar in the middle of the large room which adds to the aesthetics. It's a great atmosphere to meet a group of friends.   The food and drinks however, have been sub par. Edible but not noteworthy or worth the cost. The sole reason to come is for the atmosphere. We also went on a Sunday hoping to sit on the patio and grab some food, and their outdoor patio food market does not sell food on Sundays. Not ideal!

UXUVocqxGQLkApI3DvyXpw.text: Such an awesome vibe tucked away in the strip with multiple areas all worth exploring. Right now they only have a few of the food stations open but literally everything on the menu is delicious. More importantly this is definitely a top 10 date spot in Pittsburgh! Make sure you checkout their patio on the 2nd floor and their cantina bar on the first floor in the back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek Salad with Steak

mJOeNVdV4q0Q5u6Dffa9Cg.text: Noisy, happening food court with a wine bar and, the night I was there, live jazz music. Nice variety of food offerings, especially for sharing. A pal and I split the mac n cheese (sooo creamy) and a large farmer's salad for a total of $15. I was less impressed with my $9 glass of wine, which seemed to be a stingy pour. If it's nice you can sit on the mezzanine deck. There's typically street parking.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This &#34;glass&#34; of wine cost me $8 ($9 list price, $2 off for happy hour, $1 tip)

rFYYUftn2sJ4vfgg0Q2M_g.text: Went here for a networking happy hour. The place was large enough to accommodate 50+ easily. The drink selection was good and happy hour prices made it affordable. The chairs and couches were comfy and classy. I didn't get any food but it looked good.   The reason I left off a star was slow service. Getting a drink took about ten mins at the bar. That'd be my biggest and only complaint. Otherwise the staff was friendly and I enjoyed it all. I'd definitely return since it offers a unique environment, is accessible by bus from downtown, and is located near other places in the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OuG75O-15X0XApcbKirLjA.text: Super cool. Honestly didn't think I'd love the olive oil and vinegar tasting but it's definitely a MUST.  We walked away with like 6 bottles because it's amazing! The wine bar next door was great too. If you go upstairs there's a food court style place and wine LIBRARY   The staff is SUPER helpful and friendly if you're from out of town and need some guidance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Super cool olive tap
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Exterior

kIBZmmcpXlLifVi2dM2R5A.text: Edgar's is the only saving grace of this place. But he's not back until the weather warms up. So best just to hit his actual restaurant down at 25th.  They really want this to be like Smallman Galley or Federal Galley but...it's NOT!!  Seems like it's meant to be a destination spot but...it's NOT!!  This is more like a haven for wine drinking suburbanite women needing a few glasses (after a day at the office) before heading back to their South Hills soccer mom lives.  Definitely a wanna-be pretentious, douchie crowd.  I absolutely prefer East End Taproom that's right next door.  Ate at the pizza place and it was ok. Nothing at all to write home about. At all.  Also, let me be perfectly clear that I am referring only to the actual Pennsylvania Market which is on the second floor. The businesses on first floor (East End, wine shop, Olive Tap) are all locally owned and operated and were in place before the upstairs became a douchie existence. The downstairs businesses are amazing! Please do support them.   Bottom line: blah.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XDyibqjwhatNqfrDoHFJwQ.text: Met some family here and our experience was not fantastic. The space is huge and has potential but it's very fractured so that it is confusing. We sat in the wine bar area and although that is connected to a different bar, their systems are separate so you couldn't order from both at the same time. The waits were a bit long at the bar as well and it wasn't very crowded. Someone in our group ordered steak and frites and the "frites" were undercooked home fries.   If they work out some of the kinks here and give it a less fractured feel, it could be a great place. However, it has a way to go.

Z1Cx0wv7wA87ndz1pW1pog.text: Definitely a cool concept. Upscale and Trendy Food Hall. On a week night - parking wasn't too bad we found street parking right near the door.  My best friend and I had a great time.  Plenty of seating available.  We tried Pizza from Romulus .. it was no doubt different and delicious at the same time.  The pizza is crunchy.. so might not be for everyone.  It's the type of pizza you must eat right away or might be too hard sitting out at room temperature.   We also tried a meat plate from Charcuterie.. which was fun and well presented.    Nice beer selection but no craft beers.   If you are a wine lover.. theres plenty here for you.    There was so much more to explore as far as food.  I look forward to returning. The prices are as expected for a "hotspot" above average.   We explored the outdoor patio area and it was spacious and charming.  I can't wait to experience when the weather warms up.  What stood out the most is out friendly everyone was .. no matter what area we explored inside - everyone was super friendly and nice.. it was quite refreshing.  Thanks PA Market. I cannot wait to return!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rSVQPepjnOCSiBa4FJAPFw.text: This review is solely based on the pizza. A group of us showed up here on Saturday, late afternoon as our third or fourth bar stop. My friends made their way to the bar for drinks and I needed food.   I got the pepperoni pizza, which is my favorite, and it was LOADED with pepperoni. A nice chew to the crust, and less than 5 bucks. The 2 guys working there were really friendly and they brought it out to me on the deck where we were sitting when it was ready.   The charcuterie boards looked amazing too, would love to come back where with my husband for a couple glasses of one and have one of those.

Rcm-bpK1NiEXq-Izgt570g.text: If you haven't been down to the Strip in a while, what are u waiting for...?  This place (Pa Market) opened 6 months ago and is Awesome..!  Indoor seating, outdoor seating, huge pizza slices, charcuterie plates, ...!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very cool spot to get away from the hussle &amp; bustle (What does that even mean???) and grab a beer...

tcPCg7kA8-2Gq7jq-Apw9g.text: Love. It.   I went on a surprisingly quiet Saturday morning in the Strip and our party of 6 had no trouble getting our choice of a table. The bartender was fantastic, and while I didn't have a bloody mary, it was reported to me that they are in fact, the Best.In.Town! There is a full bar with local beer options and plenty of wine / spirits to choose from. Our table had a variety of the craft cocktails, bloody mary's, and a few beers. In addition, we all checked out the pizza and some breakfast offerings - all were delicious!   I don't recall the name of the pizza but it was essentially the perogi pizza - and it is worth it! Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UZt45IAfLM1075VbklsPmQ.text: They're definitely ironing out the kinks. Went for brunch on Saturday at 9:30am. We were the only 5 guests, which explains perhaps why they didn't have coffee (what?) or bloody Mary's. One guy came from the back to the bar where we were trying to order bloody's and said he'd get us our drinks and make it happen. I appreciate that he was trying to please the guests, but the bloody's were bland and tasted mostly like tomato juice. I saw them making a larger batch of bloody mix later (perhaps they get a bigger crowd later on?) and they seemed to be making it better (worcestershire, hot sauce, etc.).   What saved this review was the food. I had the steak and eggs. Steak was perfectly cooked with great char and salt/taste. Even the potatoes had a crispy salt crust and were delicious. My partner had the shakshuka and was a fan as well. I'd definitely go back to try some other food options. We ordered from Bistro 108 and I could see the pizza place and taco place setting up for later but they didn't seem to be open whwn we were there for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious flat iron steak and over easy eggs with potatoes. Steak cooked perfectly and very well seasoned!

ua2ENuvhtv7PZKa0du1qxA.text: The space is stunning. What a great environment for a date night, first date especially would be perfect! A small group outing or just to socialize in the lounge area. I love the library wine wall.   The pizza smelled amazing, I didn't have any but I definitely will go back. I'd like to leave a longer review but only went there once for Sunday fun day and it was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wine list
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Custom painting
Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Historical photo

LGXq6exysJSer_HcoUT0Gw.text: Checked out this new spot for the first time. I so wanted to love everything but that just wasn't the case.   I was a huge fan of the bar. We actually made it for happy hour during the week and I had a wine flight and a glass which were amazing. Sarah our bartender was  and helped us so much.  The atmosphere was also just great. Neat interior vibe. There was a pasta making class going on while we were there which looked super fun. I was sad we hadn't gotten tickets for it.  Now the reason for my 3 stars...food. I tried a few dishes from various spots on the second floor and were not impressed. I had the calamari which was underdone and the cocktail sauce it was served with needed something. I also had the Brussels sprouts from bistro 108. They were in desperate need of salt and pepper and even then, they were extremely greasy.   My husband on the other hand had the short rib from nibbles and a slice of pizza and liked both. Sooo maybe this is just a classic case of bad ordering?  Either way I would check it out again. For suuure the bar. Just maybe order different food than I did :)

Th7JyeH1BgueGcIaDJf1Iw.text: I want to preface this review by saying that we did not go inside or indulge in any of the food options, but rather had a couple of drinks at the bar in the courtyard outside. The courtyard is definitely a nice space and quite a few people were there enjoying the nice evening. We got to the bar and I asked for a cocktail menu. I was told that they only had one and the bartender would have to find it. We were also told that they were out of a lot of beers on the menu. Once I was given the menu, I was told by the bartender that she didn't know how to make half of the drinks, which was confirmed when she told me to "try again" with the first two drinks that I tried to order. This was a Saturday night! A busy one! Wouldn't you think that they'd be stocked and ready to serve? I'm not sure that we'll be going back.

OENTaU9iHifRL2YOj4DDTQ.text: Love this concept but was slightly underwhelmed overall. My group and I sat outside in the lovely courtyard on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty dead and we were disappointed to find we were not able to purchase East End taproom beers and take them outside. There is a cocktail, wine and beer menu but nothing that really wowed us. The shop downstairs looks awesome after a quick walk through. The restaurants upstairs looked tasty but nothing struck my fancy so we ventured elsewhere for food. The wine library is gorgeous and I definitely want to check that out soon- I don't see wine flights listed on their online menu but I am hoping that is something they will offer!

0ePyph3YnbqecTgWUgqLMw.text: I had the salmon filet and it was very tasty. I wish it had been cooked a little more (I like my salmon medium instead of rare), but the flavor was so delicious I didn't want to send it back! There are several restaurants in the upstairs space including Charcuterie, Nibbles, Bistro 108 and Romulus Pizza. There is also a Wine Library and regular bar. I am looking forward to adding additional eateries up here. It is a beautiful space with a balcony to Strip District people watch. There are still some kinks to work out, but this is a great new addition to the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pennsylvania Market - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

p5be2675c5NhV_3f5saCWQ.text: The Pennsylvania Market is something Pittsburgh needs. A European style market and food hall combined, bringing together small vendors, different bar areas, a few traditional restaurant concepts, and a nice blend of indoor and outdoor seating. The best part of my visit to Atlanta this past summer was the Ponce City Market, so I'm beyond thrilled we have our own version!   The market is on two floors with an outdoor area containing tables, an olive oil shop, an outdoor bar, and entrance to the East End Brewing taproom. The upper floor has a wine library with inviting chesterfield sofas as well as another bar, a restaurant, and pizza shop. You order food from the counters and take a buzzer to your table or the bar. We sat at the bar and ate pork belly, short ribs, truffle fries, and baked macaroni and cheese from the restaurant. The chef was extremely engaging and made sure to modify a few things to make them dairy-free for me! Everything was delicious, but the short ribs really stood out for me.   There's plenty of room for expansion throughout the building, and I can't wait to come back and see how the space evolves. The grand opening is in November, so I'll most certainly be there for that as well. If you haven't yet been, come down to the strip and support one of the most exciting things to open in Pittsburgh in the last five years.
